    Awesome-Selfhosted

    Self-hosting is the practice of hosting and managing applications on your own server(s) instead of consuming from üåé SaaSS providers.

    This is a list of üåé Free Software üåé network services and üåé web applications which can be hosted on your own server(s). Non-Free software is listed on the Non-Free page.

    • üåé HTML version (recommended)**, Markdown version (legacy).

    See Contributing.

    Proxy

    ^ back to top ^

    • üåé iodine - IPv4 over DNS tunnel solution, enabling you to start up a socks5 proxy listener. (¬†¬†7271‚≠ê ¬†¬†¬†558üç¥ Source Code)) ISC C/deb
    • üåé Outline Server - A proxy server that runs a Shadowsocks instance for each access key and a REST API to manage the access keys. (¬†¬†6083‚≠ê ¬†¬†¬†868üç¥ Source Code)) Apache-2.0 Docker/Nodejs
    • üåé Privoxy - Non-caching web proxy with advanced filtering capabilities for enhancing privacy, modifying web page data and HTTP headers, controlling access, and removing ads and other obnoxious Internet junk. GPL-2.0 C/deb
    • ¬†¬†4377‚≠ê ¬†¬†¬†326üç¥ sish) - HTTP(S)/WS(S)/TCP tunnels to localhost using only SSH (serveo/ngrok alternative). MIT Go/Docker
    • ¬†¬†¬†129‚≠ê ¬†¬†¬†¬†22üç¥ socks5-proxy-server) - SOCKS5 proxy server with built-in authentication and Telegram-bot for user management and user statistics on data spent (handy when you pay per GB of data). It is dockerised and simple to install. Apache-2.0 Docker

    Web Servers

    ^ back to top ^

    Web Servers and Reverse Proxies. A üåé web server is a piece of software and underlying hardware that accepts requests via üåé HTTP (the network protocol created to distribute web content) or its secure variant üåé HTTPS. A üåé Reverse Proxy is a proxy server that appears to any client to be an ordinary web server, but in reality merely acts as an intermediary that forwards requests to one or more ordinary web servers.

    Related: Proxy
